title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Annalena Baerbock could become Germany's next chancellor. Which party does she head?

A. The Christian Democrats

B. The Social Democrats

C. The Blue Dog Democrats

D. The Greens

---

2. Federal investigators searched Rudy Giuliani's Manhattan apartment seeking his communications -- with which columnist?

A. Paul Krugman

B. John Solomon

C. Andrew Sullivan

D. Rana Foroohar

---

3. Verizon is exploring the sale of media assets -- including which of these?

A. AOL

B. The WELL

C. Prodigy

D. GEnie

---

4. President Biden formally declared the Ottoman-era massacres of Armenians to be genocide. When did they occur?

A. Between 1875 and 1883

B. Between 1895 and 1903

C. Between 1915 and 1923

D. In the winter of 1928

---

5. Heavyweight boxer Andy Ruiz Jr. got control of his weight problem. What's his biggest temptation?

A. Pasta

B. Sweets

C. French fries

D. All of the above

---

6. President Biden proposed a change to the way capital gains are taxed at death. What is it?

A. At last, you could take the money with you.

B. Gains at the time of death would go untaxed.

C. A bequest other than a charitable donation would be treated as a sale for tax purposes.

D. Gains after death would be taxed at 15%.

---

7. Luminus, a hedge fund, has sold most of the assets in its largest fund to return money to investors. What's its focus?

A. Lutetium removal

B. LED patents

C. Anti-light pollution technology

D. Energy and power

---

8. Boeing reported pandemic-related delays in converting two 747-8 jets to serve as the future Air Force One. What's the contract worth?

A. Less than the ulcers it is causing

B. $39 million

C. $390 million

D. $3.9 billion

---

ANSWERS

1. D

2. B

3. A

4. C

5. B

6. C

7. D

8. D
